Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Deep Brain Stimulation in Treatment-Refractory Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either sham stimulation or active DBS

Participants.evidence: five patients with chronic, severe treatment-refractory OCD

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either sham stimulation or active DBS

Objective.evidence: This study aims to explore the acute effects of DBS in this region.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the acute response to stimulation, measured 30 days post-DBS placement.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Both patients and outcome assessors were blinded to the intervention.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Non-mood-related responses were significantly associated with ventral lead contacts (p = 0.001).

Harms.evidence: No significant side effects were associated with sham stimulation.
